title: Ever have a moment where you question your ability to play?
body:
I just had a game where I gave {{champion:114}} first blood and another kill in lane before ten minutes.

I was {{champion:80}}, who I have mastery rank 5 with.

I know bad games happen but...I can't really describe how I feel about dying twice in lane to a champion I counter so hard.
http://i2.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/original/000/011/307/Screen_Shot_2012-09-13_at_9.39.39_AM.png

I think I need a break from top lane.

Edit: You all are awesome.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body: I never question it. I know without a doubt I can't play this game worth a damn.

I think that's where I went wrong. I had this idea that I knew what was doing. 

XD

I believe that's called the ~~Freddy~~ Dunning Kruger effect. We like to think we're better (or worse) than we are because self esteem reasons. The first step in becoming good at league is accepting that most of us are trash at the game.

I miss pointblank skill shots sometimes and think that (and look exactly like the image haha). It happens. 

BE NICE TO YOURSELF THO, YOU ARE STILL A COOL HUMAN!  :)

Abilities I've missed on point blank at the crucial time:

{{champion:114}}'s Q.

{{champion:267}}'s R.

{{champion:223}}'s Q, then W (Since I didn't get the third mark on the target, when I clicked W I swallowed a friend who was about to kill the target anyways).

{{champion:131}}'s Q.

{{champion:31}} 's R (I ulted a minion next to the target, the plays).
I stunned a minion and speared a minion in that game while Fiora was near it.  I feel your pain.
The feeling when you ignite a creep... never forget
I had no Idea you could ignite creeps -_-
You can't, that's the joke
You could, actually. But that was a very long time ago, hence the "never forget."
You need to ignite that minion to assert your **dominance.**

enemy teemo, was under turret and had my last tick of ignite on him, i q'd him and e'd the minion right next to him.
died under turret, he lived with 6 health.

My god i can relate to this 100%.

{{champion:117}} *missed every point blank q within 10mins*

{{champion:429}}  "/all K GUYS IMMA PLAY A GAME"

{{champion:429}} "/all GONNA TAKE A SHOT EVERY TIME THIS LULU MISSES A Q"

{{champion:78}} "/all me too"

{{champion:22}}  "......."

{{champion:117}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} 

^ This actually happened...and im pretty sure i was tilted for the entire duration of that game for this very reason xD
-----------
{{champion:37}}  chance of me landing an ult..............lol.

{{champion:85}} Im

{{champion:68}} So

{{champion:412}} Bad

{{champion:81}} What

{{champion:267}} R

{{champion:45}} SkillShots
Towerdived a Shen as Nasus with full health, full CDR and an ult, and hit the tower with every single q and died
You know what sucks missing a {{champion:412}} or {{champion:53}} hook while standing melee range from the target #Sadlife

Playing blitz in ARAM and hooking the enemy tank.

OH GOD THROW IT BACK.
deep down blitz wanted to give amumu a hug

To be fair, sometimes when you click on a champion to do an ability, it will hit a minion right next to it for some reason.. happens to everyone.  In a game today I used Ekko's E, Clicked the champion to dash to, and ended up hitting a minion just outside of the range for some reason...
You assume he's human...

I am definitely not a robot.  

 http://www.troll.me/images/bender/i-am-not-a-robot-i-am-a-unicorn.jpg

Honestly I don't think he ever brought up unicorns.
http://www.brilliantsocialmedia.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/on-the-internet-nobody-knows-youre-a-dog-meme-1.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sparkle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fQP1x7H,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-02-18T23:45:22.111+0000)
>
> I miss pointblank skill shots

I just got Lulu yesterday. This sums up the entirety of the_** Co-Op vs AI match**_ that followed.
reported, thats offensive to all non-human players
Every single time I miss a skill shot on Scuttlecrab.
Every time scuttle jukes me
Scuttle makes Leblanc mains jealous.
It tilts me every time, man.

Yes...
I had a Pantheon game where I missed half of my normal cs within 6 minutes for no damn reason. It's pretty tilting.
Oh god...I was at 5 CS when she was at 20 I think...

Yeah, fuck that shit. Then people say you can't play your champion and shouldn't take them into ranked because FotM.

_Bitch, I played Pantheon top all through season 5 when the meta was gragas, Maokai, and Malphite._

Lost five games in a row yesterday.

Let me tell you, few things have tilted me as hard as feeding a kill level 1, before the 2 minutes mark, by missing my flash near the dragon pit. Of course, I immediately died coming back to lane because ~~I had never played versus Poppy support before~~ I suck.

I rarely have this, because I basically have the default mindset of "yeah, I'm pretty crap at League"
Less heartbreak this way, really...

What a coincidence. I just got on, played two games, and performed below my standards. 

And then I see this post. 

*Feelsbadman*
I'm with you buddy. I'm a rank 5 Sion of 70k Mastery Points, and I got dicked on by a riven last night. Fortunately, I was still useful to my team and we won
He counters Riven?
He counters Riven in the sense that she really can't snowball off of him because he just sandbags the crap out of toplane, much like Shen.

The thing is, you can have a deeply intimate knowledge with a single champion, but there is more than just knowing your own capabilities. You have to know the capabilities of your opponent just as much if you are to play the matchup as good as possible.

Fiora has a very specific way you need to fight her, and can snowball pretty hard, so it is not surprising that the downward spiral happened. Perhaps this fiora played very differently than others you have faced, or you were simply having an off day. 

Many people do not realize just how many factors go into a league game, both as a team and as an individual experience. As a competitive fighting game player, I understand the need to know match ups that total in the thousands, but league is like that on steroids. Never give up, analyze your mistakes, and learn in order to improve your game and totally trash the next fiora you fight :)
There are times I try to lead skillshots and the enemy doesn't move at all and I end up feeling like a total idiot.
Sometimes I do amazing. Other times, I question why I even chose the champion I'm using because I can't do a damn thing right with it even if I went 12/0/8 with that same champion last game.

I have 100k with {{champion:67}} and usually I'll just lose lane anyway unless my support spoonfeeds me. I get way too hype and nervous with this champion because Vayne's positioning is extremely crucial, also the APM with this champion makes me misclick

{{champion:157}} nope nope nope, I can't play him
{{champion:51}} I can't play CAIT because she is so reliant on bullying lane. decent self peel, bad ultimate for teamfights and long range really doesn't make this champion a "game changer" per-say and you have to rely on PURE fundamentals which is hard.
{{champion:119}} I cannot play this champion with the amount of Assassins I'm up against, huge micromanage, and you can become so cocky you can throw games trying to get damage off
{{champion:236}} It's sad that I main ADC but do not play Lucian.. it's more so getting the most DPS off that is challenging
{{champion:92}} I can't  q auto attack cancel.. yet.
{{champion:64}} Wardhopping not fast enough
{{champion:126}} This guy just makes me feel depressed while playing him. One combo makes you almost oom and the amount of trade-heavy gapclosing champions make lanes hard. Also if you have greater Range than Jayce's autos, you really have to outplay people perfectly or else your a poke bot with huge CDs.
{{champion:429}} I'm not bad with kalista, but sometimes I fail to execute people with rend or auto too much when I could just kill someone with rend then die
{{champion:41}} I can do the double barrel poke, but the triple barrel is a bit too difficult for me.
tip: don't play vayne
I know but it feels so rewarding to play her...

it's a trap, don't buy into it.

drugs feel rewarding, but most people will just look down on you for taking the easy way out.

or something.

I've recently experienced intense Main Confusion, where I think I've begun to suck at my main and then as the replacement main in a vicious cycle of self-doubt.


_Plays _{{champion:48}} _for a week. _


>Sure am glad that I refunded Veigar's legendary since I suck at him. Way better at trundle.

_
S6 starts. The Trolltilt begins._

>I'm gonna try mid for a bit...


_Goes 20/3 as _{{champion:45}}_ for the first time in 4 years._

>I'm feeling refunder's remorse.

_One week later starts tilting in the Final Boss skin all over again. Goes 13/3 as trundle the next game...
_
http://media2.giphy.com/media/BlXI2UCFMNTKE/giphy.gif


I also have those times as Trundle, where since he can _theoretically_ counter w/e that, I end up feeding a Riv'o or a Fifi after gloating about how good a counter Trundle is to all melee AD champs.

http://img1.reactor.cc/pics/comment/League-of-Legends-%D1%84%D1%8D%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%BE%D0%BC%D1%8B-%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%B3%D0%B0-%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%B3%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B4-%D0%98%D0%B3%D1%80%D1%8B-1019865.jpeg

Sometimes when dealing with a really screwy skill match-up like {{champion:101}} vs. {{champion:157}} , I end up making the same mistake despite knowing exactly what's going to happen in a fight.

Most times, you can chalk it up to a broken champion or a mistake or two that put you behind, but other times you're just left sitting there wondering how the hell everything went wrong with no explanation.

Well...sometimes I do... 
S4 = B 1
S5 = B 4
S6 = B 5
...although....when your adc goes 0/7 and jungler 5/14 .....thats not much of your fault

I still blame myself for beeing unable to carry xD

*Playing Bot w/ friend*
{{champion:37}} "Yo, Avi, you got this?" 
{{champion:22}} "Yeah, i'll snipe their graves with my r."
*R goes past graves*
{{champion:22}} FUCK.
{{champion:222}} "I'll snipe their top with my R."
*R hits jg with full health*
{{champion:222}} DAMN
{{champion:105}} *Tries to predict where enemy is going and throws ult in the wrong direction*
{{champion:223}} *Tries to save Adc and W's minion near them*
{{champion:23}} *Is slamming buttons on keyboards while attacking enemy top laner and activates r thinking it does damage*
{{champion:29}} *Q's and tries to sneak up to kill champion but forgets it has CC and gets humped*
{{champion:15}} *Uses ult to escape assassin only for them to kill me the moment I use it*
{{champion:1}} *Uses Q to stun one enemy during a full-man gank*
{{champion:63}} *Spam laughing at an Amumu because I think he wont dive me under a tower only for him to q me and then ult me*
{{champion:150}} *R's enemy into their turret when I meant to kill them with the damage from it*

Dont feel so bad, Fiora would have outscaled you 5 minutes into the game and murdered your entire team with a Titanic Hydra into full tank build, because Fiora.
Feel free to wipe your tears on her pbe nerfs: 
Riposte (W) cooldown increased to  24/22/20/18/16 from 19/18/17/16/15.
Bladework (E) - two changes to CD of this ability: 
Cooldown lowered to 13/11/9/7/5 from15/13/11/9/7
Cooldown now starts after you've attacked twice or buff falls off.

Fiora is broken though 

and mastery 5 =! skilled with a champion
He counters her and I usually destroy Fiora with Pantheon. Usually have fun fighting her as Pantheon for this reason. Keeps me on edge.
